radiographic_examinations.findings: Severe global left ventricular systolic dysfunction with a left ventricular ejection fraction of 10% and mild left ventricular dilatation; mild mitral, tricuspid, and aortic valvular insufficiency; mild left atrial dilatation (diameter 4.2 cm).
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Recovery of systolic function, with a left ventricular ejection fraction of 60% one month after restoration of sinus rhythm.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Corroborated findings of severe left ventricular systolic dysfunction and excluded intracardiac thrombus.
The absence of delayed enhancement may suggest potential reversibility of left ventricular dysfunction.
